idata.author: Anonymous
idata.python:
# Beginning of the song
# Basic

# Chorus and Reverb effects (Horn et al., 2022, p.140)
def chorusNote(note, beats = 2, count = 4): # Define chorus effect
        volume = 40
        spread = 0.125
        for i in range(0, count):
            offset = (random()-0.5) * spread # create variable
            fastForward(offset) # many notes same time / make it out of tune
            playNote(note, beats - offset, volume)
            rewind(beats) # back to code above
        fastForward(beats) # move on
        
with reverb(impulse = "Hall", wet = [1.0], beats = 20): # Reverb
     playNote(69, beats = 3.5)
     rest(beats = 0.05)
     playNote(67, beats = 1.5)
     playNote(69, beats = 1.5)
     playNote(72, beats = 1.5)
     playNote(67, beats = 3)

chorusNote(67) 

rest(beats = 0.5)

playNote(65, sustain = 1)
playNote(65, beats = 0.25) 
playNote(64, beats = 1.5)

rest(beats = 1) # skip a beat

playNote(62, beats = 1.5)
playNote(67, beats = 1.5)
for i in range(15): # Play Note (67) 2 times same beat
    playNote(67, beats = 0.25)
    
rest(beats = 2) # skip 2 beats (Half Rest)
# ................................................................

# Repeat
# Faster half a beat
for i in range(3): #Play Note (69) 3 times same beat
    playNote(69, beats = 0.5)
playNote(67, beats = 0.5)
playNote(69, beats = 0.5)
playNote(72, beats = 0.5)
playNote(67, beats = 1)

rest(beats = 0.5) # skip half a beat (Eighth Rest)

playNote(65, beats = 1)
playNote(64, beats = 1)

rest(beats = 0.5) # skip half a beat (Eighth Rest)

playNote(62, beats = 1)
playNote(67, beats = 1)
playNote(69, beats = 0.5)

for i in range(2): # Play Note (67) 2 times same beat
    playNote(67, beats = 0.5)
    
rest(beats = 0.5) # skip half a beat (Eighth Rest)

# Chorus part
playNote(64, beats = 1)
playNote(62, beats = 0.5)
playNote(64, beats = 0.5)
playNote(67, beats = 0.5)

rest(beats = 0.5)

playNote(60, beats = 0.5)
playNote(62, beats = 0.5)
playNote(64, beats = 0.5)
playNote(62, beats = 0.5)
playNote(60, beats = 0.5)
playNote(57, beats = 0.5)

rest(beats = 1)

playNote(60, beats = 0.5)
playNote(57, beats = 0.5)
playNote(55, beats = 0.5)
playNote(52, beats = 0.5)
playNote(55, beats = 0.5)
playNote(57, beats = 0.5)

rest(beats = 0.5)

playNote(60, beats = 0.5)
playNote(62, beats = 0.5)
playNote(64, beats = 0.5)

rest(beats = 0.5)
playNote(62, beats = 1)
playNote(60, beats = 1)

idata.author: Anonymous
idata.python:
# create functions cite page 74 
# use lower octave

# Play chords (Horn et al., 2022, p.84)
def majorChord(root):
    chord = [ root, root + 4, root + 7 ] # major chord
    return chord
Cmaj = majorChord(48)
Fmaj = majorChord(53)
Gmaj = majorChord(43)

def minorChord(root):
    chord = [ root, root + 3, root + 7 ] # minor chord
    return chord
Em = minorChord(40)
Am = minorChord(45)
range(1, 20)
playNote(Am, beats = 6, velocity = 80)

moveTo(7.80)
playNote(Gmaj, beats = 6, velocity = 80)
playNote(Em, beats = 6, velocity = 80)

idata.author: Anonymous
idata.python:
# Snare drum riser (Horn et al., 2022, p.189)

from random import randint # random number from a specific range

def snare_riser():
    for i in range(4): # 4 sets of notes
        for j in range(4): # each set has 4 notes
            playNote(note = 2, 
                     beats = pow(2, -i), # power of a number 
                     velocity = randint(85, 100)) # volume of each snare drum
moveTo(16)
snare_riser()

idata.author: Anonymous
idata.python:
#Make it faster here
# Play chords (Horn et al., 2022, p.84)
def majorChord(root):
    chord = [ root, root + 4, root + 7 ]
    return chord
Cmaj = majorChord(48)
Fmaj = majorChord(53)
Gmaj = majorChord(43)

def minorChord(root):
    chord = [ root, root + 3, root + 7 ]
    return chord
Em = minorChord(40)
Am = minorChord(45)

moveTo(26)
playNote(Am, beats = 3, velocity = 80)

moveTo(29)
playNote(Gmaj, beats = 3, velocity = 80)
playNote(Em, beats = 3, velocity = 80)
